name: Petition of District Attorney Robert L. VAN HOOVE for an Order by Exhumation. Appeal of Frederick HOFFMAN
name_abbreviation: In re District Attorney Van Hoove

judges: Before EAGEN, O’BRIEN, ROBERTS, POMEROY, NIX and MANDERINO, JJ.
POMEROY and NIX, JJ., would quash the appeal as being from an interlocutory order.
JONES, C. J., did not participate in the consideration or decision of this case.
parties: Petition of District Attorney Robert L. VAN HOOVE for an Order by Exhumation. Appeal of Frederick HOFFMAN.

opinions.text:
OPINION OF THE COURT
PER CURIAM.
Order affirmed.
POMEROY and NIX, JJ., would quash the appeal as being from an interlocutory order.
JONES, C. J., did not participate in the consideration or decision of this case.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

attorneys: David A. Binder, Marx, Ruth, Binder, Ward & Crump, Reading, for appellant.
Grant E. Wesner, Deputy Dist. Atty. for Law, C. A. Haddad, Robert L. VanHoove, Dist. Atty., Berks County, Pennsylvania, Reading, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
336 A.2d 887
Petition of District Attorney Robert L. VAN HOOVE for an Order by Exhumation. Appeal of Frederick HOFFMAN.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued April 11, 1975.
Decided May 18, 1975.
David A. Binder, Marx, Ruth, Binder, Ward & Crump, Reading, for appellant.
Grant E. Wesner, Deputy Dist. Atty. for Law, C. A. Haddad, Robert L. VanHoove, Dist. Atty., Berks County, Pennsylvania, Reading, for appellee.
Before EAGEN, O’BRIEN, ROBERTS, POMEROY, NIX and MANDERINO, JJ.
